research-section.title: Autonomous Robotic Screwdriving for High-Mix Manufacturing
research-section.description: An autonomous mobile robot system for high-mix screwdriving that handles significant uncertainties by using physics-informed learning to predict screw-tip dynamics.

research-section.title: Identifying Precursors to Failures in Robotic Lift-and-Place Tasks
research-section.description: Proactive failure prediction for lift-and-place tasks by analyzing relative object motion to anticipate failures before they occur. This method significantly improves generalization to unseen objects and provides more precise early warnings of potential failures, validated through both simulation and real-world experiments.

research-section.title: Integrating field of view in human-aware collaborative planning
research-section.venue: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
research-section.description: This paper integrates human field-of-view (FOV) limitations into robot planning by adapting to the evolving subtask intent of humans based on their limited perception using a hierarchical online planner.

research-section.title: Automated Plan Refinement for Improving Efficiency of Robotic Layup of Composite Sheets
research-section.venue: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE)
research-section.description: Robotic composite sheet layup framework that refines robot draping plans by combining human expertise with data-driven learning.

industry-section.title: Robotic Cell Calibration
industry-section.description: Designed and implemented a high-precision calibration pipeline for an industrial robotic cell involving multiple manipulators and external sensors. The system integrated Leica laser scanners and Fanuc robots to achieve accurate spatial alignment across tools, workpieces, and vision systems, enabling coordinated multi-robot operations.

industry-section.title: ROS 2 Migration & Refactoring
industry-section.description: Led the full migration of a large industrial robotics codebase from ROS Noetic (ROS 1) to ROS 2 Humble. This included redesigning node communication patterns, migrating launch and parameter systems, refactoring legacy packages, and ensuring real-time and deterministic performance across distributed components.

rightColumn.title: Migration Impact
items: Improved system modularity and separation of concerns
Reduced technical debt by removing deprecated ROS 1 APIs

industry-section.title: Surface Reconstruction for Robotic Finishing
industry-section.description: Designed a robust surface reconstruction pipeline for industrial robotic applications aimed at automating complex surface finishing tasks such as sanding, grinding, and polishing. The system fuses multi-sensor data to generate high-fidelity 3D surface models, enabling accurate toolpath planning on freeform and irregular geometries. The algorithm explores the use of SLAM, implicit surface modeling, and deep learning for generalization across materials and shapes.
